title: What are the consequences of permanent remote work? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends what group of people you’re talking about. Companies: Net increased productivityLower costsEmployees: Generally happier, more engagedLower expensesCommunities: May end up seeing people leave big cities and move to smaller cities or towns for a better quality of life and lower cost of livingCould see a surge in local entrepreneurship as small town locals get access to more job opportunities that pay higher than most small town jobsEconomy: Could see a fall in commercial real estate if more large companies move remote and don’t rent big office towersCould see a surge in restaurants that don’t have downtown locations but operate in smaller communities on the outskirts of big cities and deliver into the downtown areasThere are a lot of potential impacts, both positive and negative, that could come if the tide really turns and most office workers go remote. However, it also depends on how companies and governments react — nothing is set in stone.
